channel.title: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
channel.description:
So not too long ago I posted a song called â€œSing with meâ€ & Iâ€™m just now finding out that someone had stole it & put on there album. I donâ€™t know why someone feels the need to steal my music when I worked so hard on it ğŸ˜“
Any ideas on how to go about this?

item.title: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Hi everyone - back to original point of this thread, if someone has plagiarized your work your best recourse is to notify the owners of the platform you found it on. Most take this stuff very seriously and will take corrective action. Itâ€™s not a good look for this to get de-railed beyond that original inquiry. Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
item.dc:creator: aUstin_Haga
item.description:
He said the â€œsong and its samples were distributed with a non commercial license.â€ This is technically incorrect. You can do what you want with the actual project, but the actual song is still totally protected by copyright unless you specifically made it non commercial. The feed projects do not give you any rights to post any form of the original song whatsoever. Itâ€™s the project, and the project ONLY that is free to use (as in mess with) and share. No audio /music usage rights are granted.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Boy what an ass. He says basically how important his work is to him, but I guess itâ€™s ok to completely rip off other people. Fantom 87 should just â€œget over his feelingsâ€ right?

â€œWhen developing my album, two of the tracks, the second a remastered version of the first, I used a royalty-free sample pack provided by Auxy, the app I in part use to make my music. I hadnâ€™t realized that this â€˜packâ€™ was actually a song of the artist Fantom â€™87â€

Immediately followed by:

â€œLetâ€™s be clear on one thing: my intent was never malicious and all of my songs belong to me and have been mixed, mastered, produced, and developed by me.â€

Yeah???

item.title: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
item.dc:creator: aUstin_Haga
item.description:
Yes thereâ€™s tons of stuff like this that goes on and really the only thing you can do is report it to the website. however, that means someone found your song good enough for them to want it to be their own!

Plagiarism starts really early in a producerâ€™s career but yeah they donâ€™t benefit much from it. Plus you get a bit used to it after a while.

item.title: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
Mr_Mooo:

a better way to protect your tracks is to not select â€œinclude remix linkâ€ when uploading so people canâ€™t see and copy your projects. but nothing can be done about the featured projects

I think this is a bit of a misconception though. We only release cut down versions of featured tracks now so itâ€™s not as simple as just exporting them. If you want to steal a track from someone you can just rip the audio from SoundCloud or wherever that track is posted.

My general suggestion is to report a stolen track to the platform is uploaded on. If someone stole a track and has very few followers and plays, then I wouldnâ€™t care that much. If something blows up though, thatâ€™s when you bring out the lawyers to reclaim it.

Read full topic
item.source: What to do if your song got stolen ğŸ˜
